intro: Cynorkis tryphioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often with a rosette of leaves at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant blooms, which can range in color from purple to pink and white.
